episode_summary: The hosts share four facts: that Harriet Beatrice Stowe reportedly rewrote Uncle Tom's Cabin later in life; some tortoises (hingeback tortoises) have a hinge in their shell; Frida Kahlo's clothes and possessions were locked away in a bathroom for around 50 years; and actor Noel Gubiemi has repeatedly been cast as characters named Hector, becoming typecast.

facts.fact: My fact this week is that Harriet Beecher Stowe, author of Uncle Tom's Cabin, wrote the novel for the first time twice.
My fact is, some tortoises have hinges. So these are imaginatively named animals called hingeback tortoises, and there are loads of species, and they have a hinge at the back.
My fact this week is that after Frida Kahlo died, all her clothes and possessions spent 50 years in a bathroom.
My fact this week is that actor Noel Gubiemi played Hector in the Fast and the Furious. Since then, he has played a character called Hector in 30 other projects.
